Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: Samuel J. Gentile
Reviews.Content: After owning a low end Dell which died on me in 2 years, I thought it was time to make an investment and buy a high powered laptop which would last me awhile. I have always liked Sony's product line and fell in love with this laptop when I found it on Amazon. I have not been dissapointed at all, it is sleek, responsive and has far more power than I will probably use. The screen is incredible and the blu ray player is great. I would reccomned this laptop to anyone who is looking for a sexy multimedia powerhouse.

Reviews.Title: Working Great! Good Machine
Reviews.Author: L. Rosetta
Reviews.Content: I received my black FW465J/B about a month and a half ago. I couldn't be more pleased or satisfied with the product. I have own three other laptops before this one (Gateway, Sony, Toshiba), each lasting and in operation for more than 5 years. I still continue to use my Toshiba on a daily basis for work and personal.So far my Sony Vaio 465 is great. My current Toshiba has a 17" screen. I needed the screen space but was very tired of lugging such a large and heavy computer around. The FW-465 is perfect in size an weight, w/ a large enough screen for running and viewing multiple applications.Before purchasing, i spent a lot of time researching and comparing prices among other computers. In my opinion, Sony offered the best bang for the buck. The computer is loaded with a great graphics card, excellent processor, lots of ram, enough HD space (7200 rpm), almost HD screen, good cd/dvd burner, great styling, great/fast wifi, sufficient battery life... all in a compact and durable casing.Some people may be dissatisfied with the screen display, but i have no problems with it. Nor have i had any problems updating or with system errors. Computer is quite stable and i am gain more confidence in it everyday. I say this because i was worried about the vista 64 bit OS, sony compatibility issues, error screens, etc. No problems what so ever, as of yet,... knock on wood.I have already begun loading this computer with a few productivity applications, all are running fast and stable.Computer is quiet and does not generate a lot of heat, unlike my Toshiba. Sony and its hardware do a great job of maximizing battery life. Computer boots up quickly and awakes quickly.The mouse track pad and mouse buttons takes a bit of getting use to, perhaps only because i've become so familiar with my Toshiba (of six yrs).I have no complaints about the fw-465.

Reviews.Title: Solid Laptop
Reviews.Author: N. Gomes "Mr Dude"
Reviews.Content: My Buddy Vino did all the research on laptops..Came up with this one as a great deal with performance. I couldn't agree more.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, Awesome Performance
Reviews.Author: RAyRAy "RAyRAy"
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop.  Nice huge screen.  DVD playback is smooth and crisp.  Game play works exceedingly well, fast, and smooth.I like the keyboard design, where the keys are seperated from each other, sort of a mac look.  I do not like macs, because they are over priced and is not Windows.  The keyboard feature is nice, keeps dirt, dust, crumbs, etc out of they keys.Performance of the CPU, bus, memory, etc works very fast.  A great overall laptop for gaming, business, and entertainment.It feels sturdy overall and solid.  I have windows 7 Ultimate on here and no problem.  I didn't reinstall all the other junk it came with.One thing to note is when I open up the screen each time the point/hinge where the screen meets the laptop presses down on to the table or my lap and I feel like I will damage the screen while opening it.

Reviews.Title: See VGN-FW373J Reviews
Reviews.Author: C. Pollock
Reviews.Content: This computer is listed as the replacement for theSee VGN-FW373J. For the most part it is almost certain that myreview for that model  "Good for Casual Users, Bad for Technical Users" applies equally to this model.As would most of the other reviews.(The tech speci differences are that this has a slightly faster CPU and more video ram, but the screenfor this model is likely to be lower-spec EcoBrite not the XBRITE-FullHD of the FW373J])

Reviews.Title: Never Ever A Sony Anymore
Reviews.Author: GentlemanXP
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sony VAIO VGN-FW280J/H 16.4-Inch Laptop (2.26 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo P8400 Processor, 4 GB RAM, 7200 RPM 320 GB Hard Drive, BD-RW, Vista Premium) Gray, in May 2009 for the good price of USD 999.99. I didn't open the box for about one month, because I have 2 other Laptops an Apple and a HP.Then I used this Sony for about 2 months as a desktop, but not that much, so I didn't move or bring this Sony on th go. Then for somehow it builds moisture inside the LCD, I believe due to the hot weather, I contacted Sony Support, they asked me to send the unit to Sony Repair in San Diego which I did and they received the unit on 10.05.2009. Yesterday on 10.20.2009 at 8 pm I got an email saying that the repair estimate is USD 699.99 plus tax, whaaaaaat?...I called right away asked them to send it back, this is crazy...I just can not believe that this is a SONY, one of the biggest company in electronics/multimedia/movie industry.I will never ever buy a sony anymore...Below is the email that I got from Sony Repair:Dear Valued Sony CustomerWe have completed the repair estimate for your unit based on theinformation  you provided us.  The estimated charge for your repair  is$699.99 plus applicable sales tax. Please contact us at your earliestconvenience by phone or email to approve or refuse this estimate. Ourcontact information is listed below. To help us expedite your repairplease have your credit card number ready when you call. For yoursecurity we do not suggest including your credit card number in an emailresponse.Thank you for choosing Sony and feel free to contact us if you have anyquestions regarding your service request.Customer InformationNotification: 000300006324Model  : VGNFW280J/HSerial  : 28281639-3001748Sony Service Contact InformationLocation: SAN DIEGO, CAPhone number: (866) 942-9667 9:00AM - 4:00PM PST
